content.description: Start sitting low and right of the arete and then have fun slapping up the steadily improving arete. Landing has a sloping angle so spotters are best downhill to protect from the pit just around the corner. If you're already here for the slab you've gotta check this one out!
content.location:
43.427861,-89.736581

 Around the corner from the slab. Exit straight up and then walk/scramble to the right for the V0 downclimb.

content.description:
An excellent slab, slightly technical for the grade. The right-hand arete is off. Starts balancey and fun, holds get better and then great towards the top. Sit start on some combination of the lowest holds, obvious start is matched on the vertical seam with left-hand sidepulls.

 Exit straight up and then walk/scramble all the way to the end for the V0 downclimb. Consider adding a pad for the downclimb.
content.location:
From the Accordion boulder walk north along the cliffline with some bushwhacking. The clearest path dips just a bit and then the slab is revealed.

 Alternative approach: head straight down off the West Bluff Trail 40ft south of the Fosdal bench. The drop off is right before two trees that flank either side of the trail. The east tree has a red square marker (as of 2020).

 43.427861,-89.736581

content.description: Sort of cool.. Start with left hand on slopey edge, right on side pull.  A few power strange moves gains easier climbing.  Once on jugs 8/10 feet up you are good to drop or downclimb.  Not an eliminate per say, but it does only climb the bulging arete feature.
content.location: Just left of Dulcimer.  The stand is v0-.

content.description: This is an easy route that's good for a warmup, or if someone needs to get used to quartzite. Don't use the arete on the right to make it more interesting.Start with undercling down left and pull a few moves to get your feet up onto the face, then haul over the top.
content.location: When facing the face of The Cellist, look 90 degrees to your right. There it is, sticking out from the cliff wall.

content.description: A drop off problem but really freaking cool.. Start on a ledge left of the very obvious, super clean arete with a large sidepull jug.  Gain the arete with huge feet, and with difficulty transfer around it and get the jug break.  Traverse off or drop from there.
Stand start on the large flake. Cool compression moves lead up the blunt arete. Detached blocks are not used.
content.protection: 4+ Pads. Slanted landing that can be protected well with enough pads.
content.location: Downhill and north of The Accordion. If standing at The Accordion, face the lake and follow an overgrown gully downhill and north for ~3 mins while keeping a short cliffband to the left.

content.description: Sit start with opposing, three finger pocket side pulls.  Climb the striking little arete on cool holds to an engaging finish.  Super fun.
content.location: Just north of the Dulcimer and Accordian, on a free standing boulder below the cliff, facing east.

content.description: Sit start on a good right-hand foot with some okay finger jams. Have a good time jamming fingers then head left for a funky try-not-to-dab mantle. Would be great except for the weird top-out, however the landing is great.
content.location:
43.427861,-89.736581

 Uphill from 5th Grade Oboe, walk left around the corner. It is on the wall across from the V0 downclimb.

content.description: From below roof, start with left hand on block and right on side-pull. Pull on and move up to slopey lip. Top out.
content.location: 20 feet north of the Cellist. Problem faces north.

content.description: Start low with right hand on arete and left on small side-pull.  Move up to good left edge and top-put.  Finding the good feet is the trick.
content.location: Uphill facing line on the Accordion boulder.

content.description: Start matched on a sharpish, incut edge on the left arete.  Move right one way or the other and compress up the feature. A sweet overhanging squeeze problem!
content.location: Just below the Dulcimer on a free standing boulder and facing north.

content.description: Same start as the Accordian but move left immediately to the slab.  Fun and a little tricky.
content.location: Incut crimp on arete start. Go left up slab.

content.description: A wonderful beginner's offwidth, this climb sits starts on the obvious hold on the left side of the crack. Although you can get away with entering the crack later, the top out requires some amount of crack trickery. Prepare yourself for a full body workout.
content.location:
43.427861,-89.736581

 Around the corner from the slab. Exit straight up and then walk/scramble to the right for the V0 downclimb.

content.description: A bouldering zone at the base of a cliff band along the West Bluff Trail with easy access and a few exceptional problems.
